revised_title: Investigation of Paternity in the Compound Ascidian Diplosoma Listerianum
tldr: This study uses random amplified polymorphic DNA (RAPD) markers to assess male mating success in the compound ascidian Diplosoma listerianum. The research investigates the blockage of sperm movement in the oviduct, which prevents cross-fertilization in certain clones. The findings suggest that a somatic-gametic incompatibility mechanism regulates mating in D. listerianum, possibly involving the differential phagocytic removal of sperm sharing self-recognition markers with maternal tissue.
